trans-unit.source: There are different options to distribute network traffic using Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: There are different options to distribute network traffic using Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: These options work differently from each other, having a different feature set and supports different scenarios.
trans-unit.target: These options work differently from each other, having a different feature set and supports different scenarios.

trans-unit.source: They can each be used in isolation, or combining them.
trans-unit.target: They can each be used in isolation, or combining them.

trans-unit.source: Azure Load Balancer works at the network layer (level 4 in the OSI network reference stack).
trans-unit.target: Azure Load Balancer works at the network layer (level 4 in the OSI network reference stack).

trans-unit.source: It provides network-level distribution of traffic across instances of an application running in the same Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: It provides network-level distribution of traffic across instances of an application running in the same Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: Application Gateway works at the application layer (level 7 in the OSI network reference stack).
trans-unit.target: Application Gateway works at the application layer (level 7 in the OSI network reference stack).

trans-unit.source: It acts as a reverse-proxy service, terminating the client connection and forwarding requests to back-end endpoints.
trans-unit.target: It acts as a reverse-proxy service, terminating the client connection and forwarding requests to back-end endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager works at the DNS level.
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager works at the DNS level.

trans-unit.source: It uses DNS responses to direct end-user traffic to globally-distributed endpoints.
trans-unit.target: It uses DNS responses to direct end-user traffic to globally-distributed endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Clients then connect to those endpoints directly.
trans-unit.target: Clients then connect to those endpoints directly.

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes the features offered by each service:
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes the features offered by each service:

trans-unit.source: Any (An HTTP/S endpoint is required for endpoint monitoring)
trans-unit.target: Any (An HTTP/S endpoint is required for endpoint monitoring)

trans-unit.source: Azure VMs and Cloud Services role instances
trans-unit.target: Azure VMs and Cloud Services role instances

trans-unit.source: Any Azure Internal IP address or public internet IP address
trans-unit.target: Any Azure Internal IP address or public internet IP address

trans-unit.source: Azure VMs, Cloud Services, Azure Web Apps and external endpoints
trans-unit.target: Azure VMs, Cloud Services, Azure Web Apps and external endpoints

trans-unit.source: Can be used for both Internet facing and internal (Vnet) applications
trans-unit.target: Can be used for both Internet facing and internal (Vnet) applications

trans-unit.source: Can be used for both Internet facing and internal (Vnet) applications
trans-unit.target: Can be used for both Internet facing and internal (Vnet) applications

trans-unit.source: Azure Load Balancer and Application Gateway route network traffic to endpoints but they have different usage scenarios to which traffic to handle.
trans-unit.target: Azure Load Balancer and Application Gateway route network traffic to endpoints but they have different usage scenarios to which traffic to handle.

trans-unit.source: The table below helps understanding the difference between the two load balancers:
trans-unit.target: The table below helps understanding the difference between the two load balancers:

trans-unit.source: 5 tuple(source IP, source port, destination IP,destination port, protocol type)
trans-unit.target: 5 tuple(source IP, source port, destination IP,destination port, protocol type)

trans-unit.source: 2 tuple (source IP and destination IP), 3 tuple (source IP, destination IP and port).
trans-unit.target: 2 tuple (source IP and destination IP), 3 tuple (source IP, destination IP and port).

trans-unit.source: Can scale up or down based on the number of virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Can scale up or down based on the number of virtual machines

trans-unit.source: CookieBasedAffinity = true,rules = basic (Roud-Robin) for new connections.
trans-unit.target: CookieBasedAffinity = true,rules = basic (Roud-Robin) for new connections.

trans-unit.source: Taken out of rotation: 2 Continuous failures.
trans-unit.target: Taken out of rotation: 2 Continuous failures.

trans-unit.source: Taken out after 5 consecutive live traffic failures or a single probe failure in idle mode.
trans-unit.target: Taken out after 5 consecutive live traffic failures or a single probe failure in idle mode.
